item.description:
A roughly 3.4 mile hike of low to moderate effort with some hills on almost 1,000 forested acres. Interesting surface mining features worth exploring from long ago that are 3 gully-like features. Some trails go down to and along the Connecticut River.

The hike will be about 1.5 hours and will cover about 3.4 miles on the outer loop of trails. Meet at the Park at 2:30 PM. The hike will be over at about 4 PM. After the hike, we can optionally meet at a restaurant near Portland. Please bundle up and be warm! There may be a little snow on the ground or some mud so no sneakers, please. We need to keep feet warm.

Park Information at:
http://www.ct.gov/dep...
Trail Map at:
http://www.ct.gov/dep...

Parking: Parking will be at the pavilion in the park. If there is any snow or ice on the road, parking will likely have to be on the road shoulder before the pavilion road, as the road up to the pavilion gets very icy.

Location/directions to approximate park entrance via Mapquest :
http://www.mapquest.c...

Directions from Hartford area:
1. Take I-91 South.
2. Take Exit 22S onto CT-9 South (5.5 miles).
3. Take Exit 16 to Middletown, CT-17/ST. JOHN?S SQ. Go around sharp curve and onto the bridge over Connecticut River (1.1 miles).
4. After the bridge, take RIGHT following CT-66 East (5.0 miles).
5. In Cobalt, take RIGHT onto CT-151 (2.5 miles).
6. At stoplight, take RIGHT FORK onto Hurd Park Rd (about 0.3 miles)
7. Park entrance will be on right.
8. Follow park road to RIGHT side-road to the pavilion.
